greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Smallest integer m such that there is a partition of m with product of multiplicities of parts equal to n.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..2500
maple: b:= proc(n, i, p) option remember; `if`(n=0, `if`(p=1, 1, 0),
a:= proc(n) option remember; local m;
if isprime(n) then return n fi;
for m from 0 do if b(m$2, n)>0 then return m fi od
mathematica: b[n_, i_, p_] := b[n, i, p] = If[n == 0, If[p == 1, 1, 0], If[i < 1, 0, b[n, i - 1, p] + Sum[If[Mod[p, j] == 0, b[n - i*j, i - 1, p/j], 0], {j, 1, n/i}]]]; a[n_] := a[n] = Module[{m}, If[PrimeQ[n], Return[n]]; For[m = 0, True, m++, If[b[m, m, n] > 0, Return[m]]]]; Table[a[n], {n, 1, 100}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Dec 21 2016, translated from Maple *)
results.author: _Emeric Deutsch_ and _Alois P. Heinz_, Jan 04 2016
